```diff
+ #!/usr/bin/env python3
+ # -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
+ 
+ import os
+ import requests
+ import json
+ from datetime import datetime
+ import argparse
+ 
+ class GitHubIssuesFetcher:
+     """GitHubã®Issuesã‚’å–å¾—ã™ã‚‹ã‚¯ãƒ©ã‚¹"""
+ 
+     def __init__(self, owner, repo, token=None):
+         """
+         åˆæœŸåŒ–
+ 
+         Args:
+             owner (str): ãƒªãƒã‚¸ãƒˆãƒªã®ã‚ªãƒ¼ãƒŠãƒ¼å
+             repo (str): ãƒªãƒã‚¸ãƒˆãƒªå
+             token (str, optional): GitHub Personal Access Token
+         """
+         self.owner = owner
+         self.repo = repo
+         self.token = token or os.environ.get('GITHUB_TOKEN')
+         self.base_url = f"https://api.github.com/repos/{owner}/{repo}"
+         self.headers = {
+             'Accept': 'application/vnd.github.v3+json'
+         }
+         if self.token:
+             self.headers['Authorization'] = f'token {self.token}'
+ 
+     def fetch_all_issues(self, state='all', per_page=100):
+         """
+         ã™ã¹ã¦ã®Issuesã‚’å–å¾—
+ 
+         Args:
+             state (str): 'open', 'closed', 'all'ã®ã„ãšã‚Œã‹
+             per_page (int): 1ãƒšãƒ¼ã‚¸ã‚ãŸã‚Šã®å–å¾—æ•°
+ 
+         Returns:
+             list: Issuesã®ãƒªã‚¹ãƒˆ
+         """
+         issues = []
+         page = 1
+ 
+         while True:
+             url = f"{self.base_url}/issues"
+             params = {
+                 'state': state,
+                 'per_page': per_page,
+                 'page': page,
+                 'sort': 'created',
+                 'direction': 'desc'
+             }
+ 
+             response = requests.get(url, headers=self.headers, params=params)
+ 
+             if response.status_code != 200:
+                 print(f"ã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼: {response.status_code}")
+                 print(response.text)
+                 break
+ 
+             page_issues = response.json()
+ 
+             if not page_issues:
+                 break
+ 
+             # Pull Requestsã‚’é™¤å¤–
+             page_issues = [issue for issue in page_issues if 'pull_request' not in issue]
+ 
+             issues.extend(page_issues)
+             page += 1
+ 
+             # ãƒ¬ãƒ¼ãƒˆåˆ¶é™ã®ç¢ºèª
+             if int(response.headers.get('X-RateLimit-Remaining', 1)) < 1:
+                 reset_time = int(response.headers.get('X-RateLimit-Reset', 0))
+                 reset_datetime = datetime.fromtimestamp(reset_time)
+                 print(f"APIåˆ¶é™ã«é”ã—ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚ãƒªã‚»ãƒƒãƒˆæ™‚é–“: {reset_datetime}")
+                 break
+ 
+         return issues
+ 
+     def save_issues_to_file(self, issues, output_file='github_issues.json'):
+         """
+         å–å¾—ã—ãŸIssuesã‚’JSONãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã«ä¿å­˜
+ 
+         Args:
+             issues (list): Issuesã®ãƒªã‚¹ãƒˆ
+             output_file (str): å‡ºåŠ›ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«å
+         """
+         with open(output_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f:
+             json.dump(issues, f, ensure_ascii=False, indent=2)
+ 
+         print(f"{len(issues)}ä»¶ã®Issuesã‚’{output_file}ã«ä¿å­˜ã—ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚")
+ 
+     def print_issues_summary(self, issues):
+         """
+         Issuesã®æ¦‚è¦ã‚’è¡¨ç¤º
+ 
+         Args:
+             issues (list): Issuesã®ãƒªã‚¹ãƒˆ
+         """
+         print(f"\nåˆè¨ˆ {len(issues)} ä»¶ã®IssuesãŒè¦‹ã¤ã‹ã‚Šã¾ã—ãŸã€‚\n")
+ 
+         for i, issue in enumerate(issues, 1):
+             created_at = datetime.strptime(issue['created_at'], '%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ')
+             formatted_date = created_at.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')
+ 
+             print(f"{i}. #{issue['number']} {issue['title']}")
+             print(f"   ä½œæˆæ—¥: {formatted_date}")
+             print(f"   çŠ¶æ…‹: {issue['state']}")
+             print(f"   URL: {issue['html_url']}")
+             print()
+ 
+ 
+ def main():
+     """ãƒ¡ã‚¤ãƒ³é–¢æ•°"""
+     parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description='GitHubã®Issuesã‚’å–å¾—ã™ã‚‹ã‚¹ã‚¯ãƒªãƒ—ãƒˆ')
+     parser.add_argument('--owner', required=True, help='ãƒªãƒã‚¸ãƒˆãƒªã®ã‚ªãƒ¼ãƒŠãƒ¼å')
+     parser.add_argument('--repo', required=True, help='ãƒªãƒã‚¸ãƒˆãƒªå')
+     parser.add_argument('--token', help='GitHub Personal Access Token')
+     parser.add_argument('--state', default='all', choices=['open', 'closed', 'all'],
+                         help='å–å¾—ã™ã‚‹Issuesã®çŠ¶æ…‹ (ãƒ‡ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ«ãƒˆ: all)')
+     parser.add_argument('--output', default='github_issues.json',
+                         help='å‡ºåŠ›ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«å (ãƒ‡ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ«ãƒˆ: github_issues.json)')
+ 
+     args = parser.parse_args()
+ 
+     fetcher = GitHubIssuesFetcher(args.owner, args.repo, args.token)
+     issues = fetcher.fetch_all_issues(state=args.state)
+ 
+     if issues:
+         fetcher.print_issues_summary(issues)
+         fetcher.save_issues_to_file(issues, args.output)
+     else:
+         print("IssuesãŒè¦‹ã¤ã‹ã‚Šã¾ã›ã‚“ã§ã—ãŸã€‚")
+ 
+ 
+ if __name__ == "__main__":
+     main()
```

```diff
+ #!/usr/bin/env python3
+ # -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
+ 
+ import json
+ import argparse
+ import os
+ from datetime import datetime
+ import re
+ import csv
+ 
+ class IssueAnalyzer:
+     """GitHubã®Issuesã‚’åˆ†æã™ã‚‹ã‚¯ãƒ©ã‚¹"""
+ 
+     def __init__(self, issues_file):
+         """
+         åˆæœŸåŒ–
+ 
+         Args:
+             issues_file (str): IssuesãŒä¿å­˜ã•ã‚ŒãŸJSONãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã®ãƒ‘ã‚¹
+         """
+         self.issues_file = issues_file
+         self.issues = self._load_issues()
+         self.categories = {
+             'business': '1_Business_Requirements',
+             'functional': '2_Functional_Requirements',
+             'nonfunctional': '3_NonFunctional_Requirements',
+             'process': '4_Development_Process',
+             'risk': '5_Risk_and_Release_Plan',
+             'summary': '6_Summary'
+         }
+ 
+     def _load_issues(self):
+         """
+         Issuesã‚’ãƒ­ãƒ¼ãƒ‰
+ 
+         Returns:
+             list: Issuesã®ãƒªã‚¹ãƒˆ
+         """
+         try:
+             with open(self.issues_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f:
+                 return json.load(f)
+         except FileNotFoundError:
+             print(f"ã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼: ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ« '{self.issues_file}' ãŒè¦‹ã¤ã‹ã‚Šã¾ã›ã‚“ã€‚")
+             return []
+         except json.JSONDecodeError:
+             print(f"ã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼: ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ« '{self.issues_file}' ã®å½¢å¼ãŒä¸æ­£ã§ã™ã€‚")
+             return []
+ 
+     def categorize_issues(self):
+         """
+         Issuesã‚’ã‚«ãƒ†ã‚´ãƒªåˆ¥ã«åˆ†é¡
+ 
+         Returns:
+             dict: ã‚«ãƒ†ã‚´ãƒªåˆ¥ã®Issuesãƒªã‚¹ãƒˆ
+         """
+         categorized = {category: [] for category in self.categories.keys()}
+         uncategorized = []
+ 
+         for issue in self.issues:
+             category_found = False
+ 
+             # ãƒ©ãƒ™ãƒ«ã‹ã‚‰ã‚«ãƒ†ã‚´ãƒªã‚’åˆ¤æ–­
+             for label in issue.get('labels', []):
+                 label_name = label['name'].lower()
+ 
+                 for category in self.categories.keys():
+                     if category in label_name:
+                         categorized[category].append(issue)
+                         category_found = True
+                         break
+ 
+                 if category_found:
+                     break
+ 
+             # ã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒˆãƒ«ã‹ã‚‰ã‚«ãƒ†ã‚´ãƒªã‚’åˆ¤æ–­ï¼ˆãƒ©ãƒ™ãƒ«ã§è¦‹ã¤ã‹ã‚‰ãªã‹ã£ãŸå ´åˆï¼‰
+             if not category_found:
+                 title = issue['title'].lower()
+ 
+                 for category in self.categories.keys():
+                     if category in title or self.categories[category].lower() in title:
+                         categorized[category].append(issue)
+                         category_found = True
+                         break
+ 
+             # ã‚«ãƒ†ã‚´ãƒªãŒè¦‹ã¤ã‹ã‚‰ãªã‹ã£ãŸå ´åˆ
+             if not category_found:
+                 uncategorized.append(issue)
+ 
+         # æœªåˆ†é¡ã®Issuesã‚’ã€Œæ©Ÿèƒ½è¦ä»¶ã€ã«åˆ†é¡
+         if uncategorized:
+             categorized['functional'].extend(uncategorized)
+ 
+         return categorized
+ 
+     def generate_requirements_markdown(self, output_dir='Requirements'):
+         """
+         è¦ä»¶å®šç¾©ã®ãƒãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ€ã‚¦ãƒ³ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã‚’ç”Ÿæˆ
+ 
+         Args:
+             output_dir (str): å‡ºåŠ›ãƒ‡ã‚£ãƒ¬ã‚¯ãƒˆãƒª
+         """
+         categorized_issues = self.categorize_issues()
+ 
+         for category, issues in categorized_issues.items():
+             if not issues:
+                 continue
+ 
+             category_dir = os.path.join(output_dir, self.categories[category])
+             os.makedirs(category_dir, exist_ok=True)
+ 
+             # ã‚«ãƒ†ã‚´ãƒªåˆ¥ã®ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«åã‚’æ±ºå®š
+             filename = f"{category}_requirements.md"
+             filepath = os.path.join(category_dir, filename)
+ 
+             with open(filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f:
+                 # ãƒ˜ãƒƒãƒ€ãƒ¼
+                 f.write(f"# {self.categories[category].replace('_', ' ')}\n\n")
+                 f.write(f"*ç”Ÿæˆæ—¥æ™‚: {datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}*\n\n")
+                 f.write("*ã“ã®ãƒ‰ã‚­ãƒ¥ãƒ¡ãƒ³ãƒˆã¯GitHub Issuesã‹ã‚‰è‡ªå‹•ç”Ÿæˆã•ã‚Œã¾ã—ãŸ*\n\n")
+ 
+                 # ç›®æ¬¡
+                 f.write("## ç›®æ¬¡\n\n")
+                 for i, issue in enumerate(issues, 1):
+                     f.write(f"{i}. [{issue['title']}](#{self._create_anchor(issue['title'])})\n")
+                 f.write("\n")
+ 
+                 # å„Issueã®è©³ç´°
+                 f.write("## è©³ç´°\n\n")
+                 for issue in issues:
+                     f.write(f"### {issue['title']}\n\n")
+                     f.write(f"**Issueç•ªå·**: #{issue['number']}\n\n")
+                     f.write(f"**çŠ¶æ…‹**: {issue['state']}\n\n")
+                     f.write(f"**ä½œæˆæ—¥**: {datetime.strptime(issue['created_at'], '%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ').strftime('%Y-%m-%d')}\n\n")
+ 
+                     # ãƒ©ãƒ™ãƒ«
+                     if issue.get('labels'):
+                         f.write("**ãƒ©ãƒ™ãƒ«**: ")
+                         labels = [label['name'] for label in issue['labels']]
+                         f.write(", ".join(labels))
+                         f.write("\n\n")
+ 
+                     # æœ¬æ–‡
+                     if issue.get('body'):
+                         f.write("**è©³ç´°**:\n\n")
+                         f.write(issue['body'])
+                         f.write("\n\n")
+ 
+                     f.write(f"**URL**: {issue['html_url']}\n\n")
+                     f.write("---\n\n")
+ 
+             print(f"{filepath} ã‚’ç”Ÿæˆã—ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚")
+ 
+     def _create_anchor(self, text):
+         """
+         ãƒãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ€ã‚¦ãƒ³ã®ã‚¢ãƒ³ã‚«ãƒ¼ãƒªãƒ³ã‚¯ç”¨ã®ãƒ†ã‚­ã‚¹ãƒˆã‚’ç”Ÿæˆ
+ 
+         Args:
+             text (str): å…ƒã®ãƒ†ã‚­ã‚¹ãƒˆ
+ 
+         Returns:
+             str: ã‚¢ãƒ³ã‚«ãƒ¼ãƒªãƒ³ã‚¯ç”¨ã®ãƒ†ã‚­ã‚¹ãƒˆ
+         """
+         # å°æ–‡å­—ã«å¤‰æ›ã—ã€ã‚¹ãƒšãƒ¼ã‚¹ã‚’ãƒã‚¤ãƒ•ãƒ³ã«ç½®ãæ›ãˆã€è‹±æ•°å­—ã¨ãƒã‚¤ãƒ•ãƒ³ä»¥å¤–ã‚’å‰Šé™¤
+         anchor = text.lower().replace(' ', '-')
+         anchor = re.sub(r'[^a-z0-9\-]', '', anchor)
+         return anchor
+ 
+     def export_to_csv(self, output_file='github_issues.csv'):
+         """
+         Issuesã‚’ã‚«ãƒ†ã‚´ãƒªåˆ¥ã«CSVãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã«ã‚¨ã‚¯ã‚¹ãƒãƒ¼ãƒˆ
+ 
+         Args:
+             output_file (str): å‡ºåŠ›ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«å
+         """
+         categorized_issues = self.categorize_issues()
+ 
+         with open(output_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8', newline='') as f:
+             writer = csv.writer(f)
+             writer.writerow(['ã‚«ãƒ†ã‚´ãƒª', 'Issueç•ªå·', 'ã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒˆãƒ«', 'çŠ¶æ…‹', 'ä½œæˆæ—¥', 'URL'])
+ 
+             for category, issues in categorized_issues.items():
+                 category_name = self.categories[category].replace('_', ' ')
+ 
+                 for issue in issues:
+                     created_at = datetime.strptime(issue['created_at'], '%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ').strftime('%Y-%m-%d')
+                     writer.writerow([
+                         category_name,
+                         issue['number'],
+                         issue['title'],
+                         issue['state'],
+                         created_at,
+                         issue['html_url']
+                     ])
+ 
+         print(f"{output_file} ã‚’ç”Ÿæˆã—ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚")
+ 
+ 
+ def main():
+     """ãƒ¡ã‚¤ãƒ³é–¢æ•°"""
+     parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description='GitHubã®Issuesã‚’åˆ†æã™ã‚‹ã‚¹ã‚¯ãƒªãƒ—ãƒˆ')
+     parser.add_argument('--input', default='github_issues.json',
+                         help='å…¥åŠ›ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«å (ãƒ‡ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ«ãƒˆ: github_issues.json)')
+     parser.add_argument('--output-dir', default='Requirements',
+                         help='å‡ºåŠ›ãƒ‡ã‚£ãƒ¬ã‚¯ãƒˆãƒª (ãƒ‡ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ«ãƒˆ: Requirements)')
+     parser.add_argument('--csv', default='github_issues.csv',
+                         help='CSVãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«å (ãƒ‡ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ«ãƒˆ: github_issues.csv)')
+ 
+     args = parser.parse_args()
+ 
+     analyzer = IssueAnalyzer(args.input)
+     analyzer.generate_requirements_markdown(args.output_dir)
+     analyzer.export_to_csv(args.csv)
+ 
+ 
+ if __name__ == "__main__":
+     main()
```

```diff
- 
+ #!/usr/bin/env python3
+ # -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
+ 
+ import argparse
+ import os
+ from fetch_issues import GitHubIssuesFetcher
+ from analyze_issues import IssueAnalyzer
+ 
+ def main():
+     """
+     GitHubã®Issuesã‚’å–å¾—ã—ã¦åˆ†æã™ã‚‹ãƒ¡ã‚¤ãƒ³é–¢æ•°
+     """
+     parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description='GitHubã®Issuesã‚’å–å¾—ã—ã¦è¦ä»¶å®šç¾©ã«å¤‰æ›ã™ã‚‹ã‚¹ã‚¯ãƒªãƒ—ãƒˆ')
+     parser.add_argument('--owner', required=True, help='ãƒªãƒã‚¸ãƒˆãƒªã®ã‚ªãƒ¼ãƒŠãƒ¼å')
+     parser.add_argument('--repo', required=True, help='ãƒªãƒã‚¸ãƒˆãƒªå')
+     parser.add_argument('--token', help='GitHub Personal Access Token')
+     parser.add_argument('--state', default='all', choices=['open', 'closed', 'all'],
+                         help='å–å¾—ã™ã‚‹Issuesã®çŠ¶æ…‹ (ãƒ‡ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ«ãƒˆ: all)')
+     parser.add_argument('--output-json', default='github_issues.json',
+                         help='JSONãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«å (ãƒ‡ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ«ãƒˆ: github_issues.json)')
+     parser.add_argument('--output-csv', default='github_issues.csv',
+                         help='CSVãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«å (ãƒ‡ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ«ãƒˆ: github_issues.csv)')
+     parser.add_argument('--output-dir', default='Requirements',
+                         help='å‡ºåŠ›ãƒ‡ã‚£ãƒ¬ã‚¯ãƒˆãƒª (ãƒ‡ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ«ãƒˆ: Requirements)')
+     parser.add_argument('--skip-fetch', action='store_true',
+                         help='Issuesã®å–å¾—ã‚’ã‚¹ã‚­ãƒƒãƒ—ã—ã¦åˆ†æã®ã¿è¡Œã†')
+ 
+     args = parser.parse_args()
+ 
+     # Issuesã®å–å¾—
+     if not args.skip_fetch:
+         print("GitHubã‹ã‚‰Issuesã‚’å–å¾—ã—ã¦ã„ã¾ã™...")
+         fetcher = GitHubIssuesFetcher(args.owner, args.repo, args.token)
+         issues = fetcher.fetch_all_issues(state=args.state)
+ 
+         if issues:
+             fetcher.print_issues_summary(issues)
+             fetcher.save_issues_to_file(issues, args.output_json)
+         else:
+             print("IssuesãŒè¦‹ã¤ã‹ã‚Šã¾ã›ã‚“ã§ã—ãŸã€‚")
+             return
+ 
+     # Issuesã®åˆ†æ
+     print("\nIssuesã‚’åˆ†æã—ã¦ã„ã¾ã™...")
+     analyzer = IssueAnalyzer(args.output_json)
+     analyzer.generate_requirements_markdown(args.output_dir)
+     analyzer.export_to_csv(args.output_csv)
+ 
+     print("\nå‡¦ç†ãŒå®Œäº†ã—ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚")
+     print(f"- JSONãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«: {args.output_json}")
+     print(f"- CSVãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«: {args.output_csv}")
+     print(f"- è¦ä»¶å®šç¾©ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«: {args.output_dir}/<ã‚«ãƒ†ã‚´ãƒª>/<ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«å>")
+ 
+ 
+ if __name__ == "__main__":
+     main()
```

```diff
+ sys.path.append(os.path.dirname(os.path.abspath(__file__)))
```

```diff
+ from fetch_issues import GitHubIssuesFetcher
+ 
+ class IssueUpdater:
+     """GitHubã®Issuesã‚’è¦ä»¶å®šç¾©ã«åˆã‚ã›ã¦æ›´æ–°ã™ã‚‹ã‚¯ãƒ©ã‚¹"""
+ 
+     def __init__(self, owner, repo, token=None, requirements_dir='Requirements'):
+         """
+         åˆæœŸåŒ–
+ 
+         Args:
+             owner (str): ãƒªãƒã‚¸ãƒˆãƒªã®ã‚ªãƒ¼ãƒŠãƒ¼å
+             repo (str): ãƒªãƒã‚¸ãƒˆãƒªå
+             token (str, optional): GitHub Personal Access Token
+             requirements_dir (str): è¦ä»¶å®šç¾©ãƒ‡ã‚£ãƒ¬ã‚¯ãƒˆãƒª
+         """
+         self.owner = owner
+         self.repo = repo
+         self.token = token
+         self.requirements_dir = requirements_dir
+         self.fetcher = GitHubIssuesFetcher(owner, repo, token)
+         self.issues = []
+         self.requirements = {
+             'business': [],
+             'functional': [],
+             'nonfunctional': [],
+             'process': [],
+             'risk': [],
+             'summary': []
+         }
+ 
+     def fetch_issues(self):
+         """GitHubã®Issuesã‚’å–å¾—"""
+         print("GitHubã‹ã‚‰Issuesã‚’å–å¾—ã—ã¦ã„ã¾ã™...")
+         self.issues = self.fetcher.fetch_all_issues()
+         if self.issues:
+             self.fetcher.print_issues_summary(self.issues)
+         else:
+             print("IssuesãŒè¦‹ã¤ã‹ã‚Šã¾ã›ã‚“ã§ã—ãŸã€‚")
+         return self.issues
+ 
+     def parse_requirements(self):
+         """è¦ä»¶å®šç¾©ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã‚’è§£æ"""
+         print("\nè¦ä»¶å®šç¾©ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã‚’è§£æã—ã¦ã„ã¾ã™...")
+ 
+         # ãƒ“ã‚¸ãƒã‚¹è¦ä»¶
+         self._parse_business_requirements()
+ 
+         # æ©Ÿèƒ½è¦ä»¶
+         self._parse_functional_requirements()
+ 
+         # éæ©Ÿèƒ½è¦ä»¶
+         self._parse_nonfunctional_requirements()
+ 
+         # é–‹ç™ºãƒ—ãƒ­ã‚»ã‚¹
+         self._parse_process_requirements()
+ 
+         # ãƒªã‚¹ã‚¯ã¨ãƒªãƒªãƒ¼ã‚¹è¨ˆç”»
+         self._parse_risk_requirements()
+ 
+         # è¦ç´„
+         self._parse_summary_requirements()
+ 
+         return self.requirements
+ 
+     def _parse_business_requirements(self):
+         """ãƒ“ã‚¸ãƒã‚¹è¦ä»¶ã‚’è§£æ"""
+         business_dir = os.path.join(self.requirements_dir, '1_Business_Requirements')
+         if os.path.exists(business_dir):
+             for filename in os.listdir(business_dir):
+                 if filename.endswith('.md'):
+                     filepath = os.path.join(business_dir, filename)
+                     self._parse_markdown_file(filepath, 'business')
+ 
+     def _parse_functional_requirements(self):
+         """æ©Ÿèƒ½è¦ä»¶ã‚’è§£æ"""
+         functional_dir = os.path.join(self.requirements_dir, '2_Functional_Requirements')
+         if os.path.exists(functional_dir):
+             # ãƒãƒƒã‚¯ã‚¨ãƒ³ãƒ‰è¦ä»¶
+             backend_dir = os.path.join(functional_dir, 'backend')
+             if os.path.exists(backend_dir):
+                 for filename in os.listdir(backend_dir):
+                     if filename.endswith('.md'):
+                         filepath = os.path.join(backend_dir, filename)
+                         self._parse_markdown_file(filepath, 'functional', prefix='Backend: ')
+ 
+             # ãƒ•ãƒ­ãƒ³ãƒˆã‚¨ãƒ³ãƒ‰è¦ä»¶
+             frontend_dir = os.path.join(functional_dir, 'frontend')
+             if os.path.exists(frontend_dir):
+                 for filename in os.listdir(frontend_dir):
+                     if filename.endswith('.md'):
+                         filepath = os.path.join(frontend_dir, filename)
+                         self._parse_markdown_file(filepath, 'functional', prefix='Frontend: ')
+ 
+             # ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿è¦ä»¶
+             data_dir = os.path.join(functional_dir, 'data')
+             if os.path.exists(data_dir):
+                 for filename in os.listdir(data_dir):
+                     if filename.endswith('.md'):
+                         filepath = os.path.join(data_dir, filename)
+                         self._parse_markdown_file(filepath, 'functional', prefix='Data: ')
+ 
+     def _parse_nonfunctional_requirements(self):
+         """éæ©Ÿèƒ½è¦ä»¶ã‚’è§£æ"""
+         nonfunctional_dir = os.path.join(self.requirements_dir, '3_NonFunctional_Requirements')
+         if os.path.exists(nonfunctional_dir):
+             for filename in os.listdir(nonfunctional_dir):
+                 if filename.endswith('.md'):
+                     filepath = os.path.join(nonfunctional_dir, filename)
+                     self._parse_markdown_file(filepath, 'nonfunctional')
+ 
+     def _parse_process_requirements(self):
+         """é–‹ç™ºãƒ—ãƒ­ã‚»ã‚¹è¦ä»¶ã‚’è§£æ"""
+         process_dir = os.path.join(self.requirements_dir, '4_Development_Process')
+         if os.path.exists(process_dir):
+             for filename in os.listdir(process_dir):
+                 if filename.endswith('.md'):
+                     filepath = os.path.join(process_dir, filename)
+                     self._parse_markdown_file(filepath, 'process')
+ 
+     def _parse_risk_requirements(self):
+         """ãƒªã‚¹ã‚¯ã¨ãƒªãƒªãƒ¼ã‚¹è¨ˆç”»ã‚’è§£æ"""
+         risk_dir = os.path.join(self.requirements_dir, '5_Risk_and_Release_Plan')
+         if os.path.exists(risk_dir):
+             for filename in os.listdir(risk_dir):
+                 if filename.endswith('.md'):
+                     filepath = os.path.join(risk_dir, filename)
+                     self._parse_markdown_file(filepath, 'risk')
+ 
+     def _parse_summary_requirements(self):
+         """è¦ç´„ã‚’è§£æ"""
+         summary_dir = os.path.join(self.requirements_dir, '6_Summary')
+         if os.path.exists(summary_dir):
+             for filename in os.listdir(summary_dir):
+                 if filename.endswith('.md'):
+                     filepath = os.path.join(summary_dir, filename)
+                     self._parse_markdown_file(filepath, 'summary')
+ 
+     def _parse_markdown_file(self, filepath, category, prefix=''):
+         """ãƒãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ€ã‚¦ãƒ³ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã‚’è§£æã—ã¦è¦ä»¶ã‚’æŠ½å‡º"""
+         try:
+             with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f:
+                 content = f.read()
+ 
+                 # ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«åã‹ã‚‰è¦ä»¶ã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒ—ã‚’å–å¾—
+                 filename = os.path.basename(filepath)
+                 req_type = os.path.splitext(filename)[0].replace('_', ' ')
+ 
+                 # è¦‹å‡ºã—ã‚’æŠ½å‡º
+                 headings = re.findall(r'^##\s+(.+)$', content, re.MULTILINE)
+ 
+                 for heading in headings:
+                     # è¦‹å‡ºã—ã®ä¸‹ã®ãƒ†ã‚­ã‚¹ãƒˆã‚’æŠ½å‡º
+                     pattern = r'##\s+' + re.escape(heading) + r'\s*\n(.*?)(?=^##|\Z)'
+                     matches = re.findall(pattern, content, re.MULTILINE | re.DOTALL)
+ 
+                     if matches:
+                         description = matches[0].strip()
+ 
+                         # ãƒªã‚¹ãƒˆé …ç›®ã‚’æŠ½å‡º
+                         list_items = re.findall(r'^\s*[-*]\s+(.+)$', description, re.MULTILINE)
+ 
+                         if list_items:
+                             for item in list_items:
+                                 self.requirements[category].append({
+                                     'title': f"{prefix}{req_type}: {heading}",
+                                     'description': item,
+                                     'source_file': filepath
+                                 })
+                         else:
+                             self.requirements[category].append({
+                                 'title': f"{prefix}{req_type}: {heading}",
+                                 'description': description,
+                                 'source_file': filepath
+                             })
+         except Exception as e:
+             print(f"ã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼: {filepath} ã®è§£æä¸­ã«ã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼ãŒç™ºç”Ÿã—ã¾ã—ãŸ: {e}")
+ 
+     def generate_issue_updates(self):
+         """Issuesã®æ›´æ–°å†…å®¹ã‚’ç”Ÿæˆ"""
+         print("\nIssuesã®æ›´æ–°å†…å®¹ã‚’ç”Ÿæˆã—ã¦ã„ã¾ã™...")
+ 
+         updates = []
+ 
+         # æ—¢å­˜ã®Issueã‚’ã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒˆãƒ«ã§ãƒãƒƒãƒ”ãƒ³ã‚°
+         existing_issues = {issue['title']: issue for issue in self.issues}
+ 
+         # å„ã‚«ãƒ†ã‚´ãƒªã®è¦ä»¶ã«å¯¾ã—ã¦æ›´æ–°ã‚’ç”Ÿæˆ
+         for category, requirements in self.requirements.items():
+             for req in requirements:
+                 title = req['title']
+                 description = req['description']
+                 source_file = req['source_file']
+ 
+                 if title in existing_issues:
+                     # æ—¢å­˜ã®Issueã‚’æ›´æ–°
+                     issue = existing_issues[title]
+ 
+                     # èª¬æ˜ãŒå¤‰æ›´ã•ã‚Œã¦ã„ã‚‹å ´åˆã®ã¿æ›´æ–°
+                     if description not in issue.get('body', ''):
+                         updates.append({
+                             'action': 'update',
+                             'issue_number': issue['number'],
+                             'title': title,
+                             'body': f"{description}\n\n---\n\n**Source:** {source_file}\n**Updated:** {datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}",
+                             'labels': [f"category:{category}"]
+                         })
+                 else:
+                     # æ–°è¦Issueã‚’ä½œæˆ
+                     updates.append({
+                         'action': 'create',
+                         'title': title,
+                         'body': f"{description}\n\n---\n\n**Source:** {source_file}\n**Created:** {datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}",
+                         'labels': [f"category:{category}"]
+                     })
+ 
+         # è¦ä»¶å®šç¾©ã«å­˜åœ¨ã—ãªã„Issueã‚’ã‚¯ãƒ­ãƒ¼ã‚º
+         all_req_titles = set()
+         for category, requirements in self.requirements.items():
+             for req in requirements:
+                 all_req_titles.add(req['title'])
+ 
+         for issue in self.issues:
+             if issue['title'] not in all_req_titles and issue['state'] == 'open':
+                 updates.append({
+                     'action': 'close',
+                     'issue_number': issue['number'],
+                     'title': issue['title'],
+                     'body': f"ã“ã®è¦ä»¶ã¯æœ€æ–°ã®è¦ä»¶å®šç¾©ã«å«ã¾ã‚Œã¦ã„ãªã„ãŸã‚ã€ã‚¯ãƒ­ãƒ¼ã‚ºã—ã¾ã™ã€‚\n\n**Closed:** {datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}",
+                     'labels': ['obsolete']
+                 })
+ 
+         return updates
+ 
+     def save_updates(self, updates, output_file='issue_updates.json'):
+         """æ›´æ–°å†…å®¹ã‚’JSONãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã«ä¿å­˜"""
+         with open(output_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f:
+             json.dump(updates, f, ensure_ascii=False, indent=2)
+ 
+         print(f"{len(updates)}ä»¶ã®æ›´æ–°å†…å®¹ã‚’{output_file}ã«ä¿å­˜ã—ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚")
+ 
+     def apply_updates(self, updates, dry_run=True):
+         """æ›´æ–°å†…å®¹ã‚’GitHubã«é©ç”¨"""
+         if dry_run:
+             print("\n[ãƒ‰ãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒ©ãƒ³] ä»¥ä¸‹ã®æ›´æ–°ã‚’é©ç”¨ã—ã¾ã™:")
+         else:
+             print("\nä»¥ä¸‹ã®æ›´æ–°ã‚’é©ç”¨ã—ã¾ã™:")
+ 
+         for update in updates:
+             action = update['action']
+             title = update['title']
+ 
+             if action == 'create':
+                 print(f"æ–°è¦ä½œæˆ: {title}")
+                 if not dry_run:
+                     # GitHubã®Issueä½œæˆAPIã‚’å‘¼ã³å‡ºã™
+                     pass
+             elif action == 'update':
+                 issue_number = update['issue_number']
+                 print(f"æ›´æ–°: #{issue_number} {title}")
+                 if not dry_run:
+                     # GitHubã®Issueæ›´æ–°APIã‚’å‘¼ã³å‡ºã™
+                     pass
+             elif action == 'close':
+                 issue_number = update['issue_number']
+                 print(f"ã‚¯ãƒ­ãƒ¼ã‚º: #{issue_number} {title}")
+                 if not dry_run:
+                     # GitHubã®Issueã‚¯ãƒ­ãƒ¼ã‚ºAPIã‚’å‘¼ã³å‡ºã™
+                     pass
+ 
+         if dry_run:
+             print("\nãƒ‰ãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒ©ãƒ³ãŒå®Œäº†ã—ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚å®Ÿéš›ã«é©ç”¨ã™ã‚‹ã«ã¯ --apply ã‚ªãƒ—ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³ã‚’æŒ‡å®šã—ã¦ãã ã•ã„ã€‚")
+         else:
+             print("\næ›´æ–°ãŒå®Œäº†ã—ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚")
+ 
+ 
+ def main():
+     """ãƒ¡ã‚¤ãƒ³é–¢æ•°"""
+     parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description='GitHubã®Issuesã‚’è¦ä»¶å®šç¾©ã«åˆã‚ã›ã¦æ›´æ–°ã™ã‚‹ã‚¹ã‚¯ãƒªãƒ—ãƒˆ')
+     parser.add_argument('--owner', required=True, help='ãƒªãƒã‚¸ãƒˆãƒªã®ã‚ªãƒ¼ãƒŠãƒ¼å')
+     parser.add_argument('--repo', required=True, help='ãƒªãƒã‚¸ãƒˆãƒªå')
+     parser.add_argument('--token', help='GitHub Personal Access Token')
+     parser.add_argument('--requirements-dir', default='Requirements', help='è¦ä»¶å®šç¾©ãƒ‡ã‚£ãƒ¬ã‚¯ãƒˆãƒª (ãƒ‡ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ«ãƒˆ: Requirements)')
+     parser.add_argument('--output', default='issue_updates.json', help='æ›´æ–°å†…å®¹ã®å‡ºåŠ›ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ« (ãƒ‡ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ«ãƒˆ: issue_updates.json)')
+     parser.add_argument('--apply', action='store_true', help='æ›´æ–°ã‚’å®Ÿéš›ã«é©ç”¨ã™ã‚‹ (ãƒ‡ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ«ãƒˆ: ãƒ‰ãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒ©ãƒ³)')
+ 
+     args = parser.parse_args()
+ 
+     updater = IssueUpdater(args.owner, args.repo, args.token, args.requirements_dir)
+ 
+     # GitHubã®Issuesã‚’å–å¾—
+     updater.fetch_issues()
+ 
+     # è¦ä»¶å®šç¾©ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã‚’è§£æ
+     updater.parse_requirements()
+ 
+     # Issuesã®æ›´æ–°å†…å®¹ã‚’ç”Ÿæˆ
+     updates = updater.generate_issue_updates()
+ 
+     # æ›´æ–°å†…å®¹ã‚’JSONãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã«ä¿å­˜
+     updater.save_updates(updates, args.output)
+ 
+     # æ›´æ–°å†…å®¹ã‚’é©ç”¨
+     updater.apply_updates(updates, not args.apply)
+ 
+ 
+ if __name__ == "__main__":
+     main()
```

```diff
+     def _create_issue(self, update):
+         """æ–°è¦Issueã‚’ä½œæˆ"""
+         url = f"{self.base_url}/issues"
+         data = {
+             'title': update['title'],
+             'body': update['body'],
+             'labels': update['labels']
+         }
+ 
+         response = requests.post(url, headers=self.headers, json=data)
+ 
+         if response.status_code != 201:
+             raise Exception(f"APIã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼: {response.status_code} - {response.text}")
+ 
+         return response.json()
+ 
+     def _update_issue(self, update):
+         """æ—¢å­˜ã®Issueã‚’æ›´æ–°"""
+         url = f"{self.base_url}/issues/{update['issue_number']}"
+         data = {
+             'title': update['title'],
+             'body': update['body'],
+             'labels': update['labels']
+         }
+ 
+         response = requests.patch(url, headers=self.headers, json=data)
+ 
+         if response.status_code != 200:
+             raise Exception(f"APIã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼: {response.status_code} - {response.text}")
+ 
+         return response.json()
+ 
+     def _close_issue(self, update):
+         """Issueã‚’ã‚¯ãƒ­ãƒ¼ã‚º"""
+         url = f"{self.base_url}/issues/{update['issue_number']}"
+         data = {
+             'state': 'closed',
+             'body': update['body'],
+             'labels': update['labels']
+         }
+ 
+         response = requests.patch(url, headers=self.headers, json=data)
+ 
+         if response.status_code != 200:
+             raise Exception(f"APIã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼: {response.status_code} - {response.text}")
+ 
+         return response.json()
```
